Field Label: Record ID
Preferred language
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: en, English | de, Deutsch

Field Label: I have read the information above and consider volunteering for this study.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes, let's proceed with the questionnaire. | 0, No, I prefer not to take part.

Section Header:
Exclusion Criteria

You will be asked about some symptoms or disorders you may have experienced. Please answer honestly, so that we can ensure your well-being and safety during the course of this study.

If you are not sure whether something you experienced counts as a symptom or disorder, please choose "maybe" and specify it.
Field Label: Are you between 18 and 35 years old?
Do you have any difficulty distinguishing between red and green (colour-blindness)?

At any point in your life, have you experienced any of the following:

  • Uncontrolled shaking movements of your whole body or parts of it, with full or partial loss of consciousness (Epilepsy, Seizures)
  • Pulsating headaches possibly accompanied by nausea, sensitivity to light / sound / smell, visual disturbances (Migraine)
  • Surgery on your brain (e.g., to remove a brain tumor, to perform an implant…)
  • Severe concussion
  • Stroke
  • Other neurological conditions
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes | 2, Maybe | 0, No

Field Label: Please specify:
Has any of your first-degree relatives been diagnosed with Epilepsy, or experienced seizures?

In the past month, have you consumed any of these substances?

  • Nicotine
  • Cannabis
  • Psychopharmacological medication
  • Other drugs
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes | 2, Maybe | 0, No

Field Label: Please specify:

In the past 6 months, have you experienced any of these sleep disturbances? Or has anyone remarked that you do?

  • Regular difficulty falling or staying asleep (Insomnia)
  • Walking or carrying out complex activities during the night while not fully awake, without remembering them afterward (Sleepwalking)
  • Involuntary habitual grinding of the teeth during sleep (Bruxism)
  • Excessive daytime sleepiness with sudden muscle weakness (Narcolepsy)
  • Unpleasant “creeping” sensation and pain in the lower legs that can be relieved by movement of the legs, such as walking or kicking (Restless Legs Syndrome)
  • Periodically interrupted breathing during sleep that causes gasping or “snorting” noises, more than just snoring (Sleep Apnoea)
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes | 2, Maybe | 0, No

Field Label: Please specify:

In the past 6 months, have you experienced any of these psychiatric symptoms?

  • Depressed mood
  • Manic mood
  • Excessive fears or worries
  • Substance abuse
  • Hallucinations or delusions
  • Suicidal thoughts
  • Other mental issues
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes | 2, Maybe | 0, No

Field Label: Please specify:
In the past month, I have been a shift- or night-worker:
In the past month, I have travelled across two or more time zones:
Please double-check: Have you correctly chosen the options that apply to you?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes
Branching Logic (Show field only if...): [cutoff_age] = '0' or [cutoff_colour] = '1' or [cutoff_neuro] = '1' or [cutoff_sleep] = '1' or [cutoff_psych] = '1' or [cutoff_substances] = '1' or [cutoff_shiftwork] = '1' or [cutoff_travel] = '1' or [epilepsy_family] = '1'

Field Label: How often do you have a drink containing alcohol?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, Never | 1, Monthly or less | 2, Two to four times a month | 3, Two to three times a week | 4, Four or more times a week

Field Label: How many drinks containing alcohol do you have on a typical day when you are drinking?
Field Note: One drink = 1 small beer / 1 small glass of wine / a mixed drink with 1 portion of spirits

Field Label: How often do you have six or more drinks on one occasion?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, Never | 1, Less than monthly | 2, Monthly | 3, Weekly | 4, Daily or almost daily
Field Note: One drink = 1 small beer / 1 small glass of wine / a mixed drink with 1 portion of spirits

Field Label: How often during the last year have you found that you were not able to stop drinking once you had started?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, Never | 1, Less than monthly | 2, Monthly | 3, Weekly | 4, Daily or almost daily

Field Label: How often during the last year have you failed to do what was normally expected of you because of drinking?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, Never | 1, Less than monthly | 2, Monthly | 3, Weekly | 4, Daily or almost daily

Field Label: How often during the last year have you needed a first drink in the morning to get yourself going after a heavy drinking session?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, Never | 1, Less than monthly | 2, Monthly | 3, Weekly | 4, Daily or almost daily

Field Label: How often during the last year have you had a feeling of guilt or remorse after drinking?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, Never | 1, Less than monthly | 2, Monthly | 3, Weekly | 4, Daily or almost daily

Field Label: How often during the last year have you been unable to remember what happened the night before because you had been drinking?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, Never | 1, Less than monthly | 2, Monthly | 3, Weekly | 4, Daily or almost daily

Field Label: Have you or someone else been injured as a result of your drinking?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, No | 2, Yes, but not in the last year | 4, Yes, during the last year

Field Label: Has a relative or friend, doctor or other health worker been concerned about your drinking or suggested you cut down?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, No | 2, Yes, but not in the last year | 4, Yes, during the last year

Field Label: AUDIT summed score
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: [audit_q1] + [audit_q2] + [audit_q3] + [audit_q4] + [audit_q5] + [audit_q6] + [audit_q7] + [audit_q8] + [audit_q9] + [audit_q10]

Field Label: 1. During the past month, at what time have you usually gone to bed at night?
2. During the past month, how long (in minutes) has it usually taken you to fall asleep each night?
3. During the past month, at what time have you usually gotten up in the morning?
4. During the past month, how many hours of <u>actual sleep</u> did you get at night? (This may be different than the number of hours you spent in bed.)

Section Header:
For each of the remaining questions, choose the best response. Please answer all questions.

Field Label: Normally, I work ___ days / week:

Section Header:
Please answer all the following questions even if you do not work, or work 7 days / week.
Use the 24-hour format (e.g., 23:00 instead of 11 PM).
Field Label: On workdays, I normally fall asleep at:
Field Note: This is NOT when you get into bed, but rather when you fall asleep

Field Label: On workdays, I normally wake up at:
Field Note: This is NOT when you get out of bed, but rather when you wake up

Field Label: On work-free days, when I DON'T use an alarm clock, I normally fall asleep at:
Field Note: This is NOT when you get into bed, but rather when you fall asleep

Field Label: On work-free days, when I DON'T use an alarm clock, I normally wake up at:
